analytic.title: The East Syrian or Nestorian Rite: The Evening, Night, and Morning Services, with the Propria of the Liturgy, as Said on the Feast of the Epiphany, from the Gaza of the Library of the Propaganda Fide in Rome

monogr.title: Rituale Armenorum: Being the Administration of the Sacraments and the Breviary Rites of the Armenian Church, together with the Greek Rites of Baptism and Epiphany Edited from the Oldest Mss.

body.bibl: Maclean, Arthur John. “The East Syrian or Nestorian Rite: The Evening, Night, and Morning Services, with the Propria of the Liturgy, as Said on the Feast of the Epiphany, from the Gaza of the Library of the Propaganda Fide in Rome.” In Rituale Armenorum: Being the Administration of the Sacraments and the Breviary Rites of the Armenian Church, Together with the Greek Rites of Baptism and Epiphany Edited from the Oldest Mss., edited by Frederick Cornwallis Conybeare, 298–388. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1905.

Arthur John Maclean, The East Syrian or Nestorian Rite: The Evening, Night, and Morning Services, with the Propria of the Liturgy, as Said on the Feast of the Epiphany, from the Gaza of the Library of the Propaganda Fide in Rome, in Rituale Armenorum: Being the Administration of the Sacraments and the Breviary Rites of the Armenian Church, Together with the Greek Rites of Baptism and Epiphany Edited from the Oldest Mss., ed. Frederick Cornwallis Conybeare (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1905), 298–388.
